info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued October 31 at 4:36AM EDT until October 31 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Newport/Morehead City NC
info.description:
* WHAT...For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 5 to 8 feet expected in the surf zone. For the Beach Hazards Statement, dangerous rip currents and large breaking waves expected in the surf zone.
* WHERE...For the High Surf Advisory, Core Banks beaches. For the Beach Hazards Statement, Core Banks and Shackleford Banks beaches.
* WHEN...For the Beach Hazards Statement, through this evening. For the High Surf Advisory, until 6 PM EDT this evening.
* IMPACTS...Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and localized beach erosion.
info.instruction:
Inexperienced swimmers should remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions.
Life-threatening rip currents. If caught in a rip current, remain calm. Swim in a direction following the shoreline. If tired, float or tread water until out of the rip current. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.
Shore break occurs when waves break directly on the beach. It is extremely important to protect your head and neck whenever you are in breaking waves by keeping your hands in front of you at all times.

parameter.value: BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM EDT THIS EVENING
